20101230140249.000|20101230140251.000|TR0|southeast of Kokomo.  We have no reports

20101230142235.000|20101230142238.000|TR0|(BUZZ)

20101230142243.000|20101230142245.000|TR0|were 11.  In 1800, New Orleans was a US 
20101230142245.000|20101230142248.000|TR0|port.
20101230142248.000|20101230142250.000|TR0|
20101230142250.000|20101230142253.000|TR0|(BUZZ)
20101230142253.000|20101230142255.000|TR0|
20101230142255.000|20101230142258.000|TR0|SAVIDGE (voice-over):  No.  It was still 
20101230142258.000|20101230142300.000|TR0|under Spanish control.
20101230142300.000|20101230142303.000|TR0|
20101230142303.000|20101230142305.000|TR0|These and dozens of other errors can be 
20101230142305.000|20101230142308.000|TR0|found in the textbook handed out to 
20101230142308.000|20101230142310.000|TR0|thousands of Virginia fourth graders.  
20101230142310.000|20101230142313.000|TR0|Problems with the book "Our Virginia:  
20101230142313.000|20101230142315.000|TR0|Past  &  Present," published by Five Ponds 
20101230142315.000|20101230142318.000|TR0|Press, first surfaced last October, as 
20101230142318.000|20101230142320.000|TR0|reported by "The Washington Post," when 
20101230142320.000|20101230142323.000|TR0|the mother of one fourth grader, a college 
20101230142323.000|20101230142325.000|TR0|history professor, spotted several lines 
20101230142325.000|20101230142328.000|TR0|on page 122.
20101230142328.000|20101230142330.000|TR0|
20101230142330.000|20101230142333.000|TR0|CAROL SHERIFF, PARENT OF A VIRGINIA FOURTH 
20101230142333.000|20101230142335.000|TR0|GRADER:  It was particularly jarring when 
20101230142335.000|20101230142338.000|TR0|I got to this one passage that was so at 
20101230142338.000|20101230142340.000|TR0|odds with what historians have been saying 
20101230142340.000|20101230142343.000|TR0|about who participated in the Civil War.
20101230142343.000|20101230142345.000|TR0|
20101230142345.000|20101230142348.000|TR0|SAVIDGE (voice-over):  The book says 
20101230142348.000|20101230142350.000|TR0|thousands of blacks fought in the 
20101230142350.000|20101230142353.000|TR0|Confederate ranks, something not supported 
20101230142353.000|20101230142355.000|TR0|by mainstream Civil War scholarship.  But 
20101230142355.000|20101230142358.000|TR0|it's the next line that's just plain 
20101230142358.000|20101230142400.000|TR0|wrong.  Quote, "including two black 
20101230142400.000|20101230142403.000|TR0|battalions under the command of Stonewall 
20101230142403.000|20101230142405.000|TR0|Jackson," unquote.
20101230142405.000|20101230142408.000|TR0|
20101230142408.000|20101230142410.000|TR0|SHERIFF:  Textbook actually does note that 
20101230142410.000|20101230142413.000|TR0|it wasn't until 1865 that 
20101230142413.000|20101230142415.000|TR0|African-Americans could legally serve in 
20101230142415.000|20101230142418.000|TR0|the Confederate army.  It also tells 
20101230142418.000|20101230142420.000|TR0|children that Stonewall Jackson died in 
20101230142420.000|20101230142423.000|TR0|1863.
20101230142423.000|20101230142425.000|TR0|
20101230142425.000|20101230142428.000|TR0|SAVIDGE (voice-over):  The error about 
20101230142428.000|20101230142430.000|TR0|blacks serving in the Confederate army was 
20101230142430.000|20101230142433.000|TR0|outrageous to many in academia.
20101230142433.000|20101230142435.000|TR0|
20101230142435.000|20101230142438.000|TR0|JEREMY MAYER, GEORGE MASON UNIVERSITY:  It 
20101230142438.000|20101230142440.000|TR0|is the equivalent of Holocaust denial 
20101230142440.000|20101230142443.000|TR0|being taught in the public schools.  But 
20101230142443.000|20101230142445.000|TR0|worse, it's also the equivalent of saying 
20101230142445.000|20101230142448.000|TR0|that the Jews helped the Holocaust.
20101230142448.000|20101230142450.000|TR0|
20101230142450.000|20101230142453.000|TR0|SAVIDGE (voice-over):  The textbook's 
20101230142453.000|20101230142455.000|TR0|author, who is not a historian, said she 
20101230142455.000|20101230142458.000|TR0|found the information while researching 
20101230142458.000|20101230142500.000|TR0|online.  The publisher defended the 
20101230142500.000|20101230142503.000|TR0|author, saying she used real books, as 
20101230142503.000|20101230142505.000|TR0|well.
20101230142505.000|20101230142508.000|TR0|
20101230142508.000|20101230142510.000|TR0|LOU SCOLNIK, OWNER, FIVE PONDS PRESS (via 
20101230142510.000|20101230142513.000|TR0|telephone):  I don't think the author 
20101230142513.000|20101230142515.000|TR0|could necessarily be accused of being 
20101230142515.000|20101230142518.000|TR0|stupid and doing internet-only research.
20101230142518.000|20101230142520.000|TR0|
20101230142520.000|20101230142523.000|TR0|SAVIDGE (voice-over):  Because of the 
20101230142523.000|20101230142525.000|TR0|outcry in November, the Virginia Board of 
20101230142525.000|20101230142528.000|TR0|Education hired five historians to review 
20101230142528.000|20101230142530.000|TR0|the textbook.  They were the ones who 
20101230142530.000|20101230142533.000|TR0|found the dozens more mistakes or 
20101230142533.000|20101230142535.000|TR0|misrepresentations, leading one to ask, 
20101230142535.000|20101230142538.000|TR0|quote, "How in the world did these books 
20101230142538.000|20101230142540.000|TR0|get approved?"  He recommended they be 
20101230142540.000|20101230142543.000|TR0|pulled from the classroom immediately.
20101230142543.000|20101230142545.000|TR0|
20101230142545.000|20101230142548.000|TR0|SAVIDGE (on camera):  As to who selected

20101230142553.000|20101230142555.000|TR0|districts in Virginia that are now using 
20101230142555.000|20101230142558.000|TR0|the books.
20101230142558.000|20101230142600.000|TR0|
20101230142600.000|20101230142603.000|TR0|To fix that problems of the wrong

20101230142605.000|20101230142608.000|TR0|the Confederacy, the publisher came up 
20101230142608.000|20101230142610.000|TR0|with this idea.  Stickers. That would be 
20101230142610.000|20101230142613.000|TR0|with the right information placed over the 
20101230142613.000|20101230142615.000|TR0|wrong information.  The problem is, now 
20101230142615.000|20101230142618.000|TR0|there are so many errors in the textbook,

20101230143347.000|20101230143350.000|TR0|mean, a lot of people don't realize this 
20101230143350.000|20101230143352.000|TR0|is a possibility.  Even people inside of 
20101230143352.000|20101230143355.000|TR0|the airport waiting for their flights or

20101230143402.000|20101230143405.000|TR0|is that new technologies can actually help 
20101230143405.000|20101230143407.000|TR0|speed that process up, including Twitter.
20101230143407.000|20101230143410.000|TR0|
20101230143410.000|20101230143412.000|TR0|Let me show you a couple examples of 
20101230143412.000|20101230143415.000|TR0|what's going on over the last couple of

20101230143417.000|20101230143420.000|TR0|Airlines called Delta Assist and they have 
20101230143420.000|20101230143422.000|TR0|been interacting with passengers on 
20101230143422.000|20101230143425.000|TR0|Twitter trying to help them rebook.
20101230143425.000|20101230143427.000|TR0|

20101230143430.000|20101230143432.000|TR0|Assist just sent out to someone just 
20101230143432.000|20101230143435.000|TR0|minutes ago today.  This is from someone 
20101230143435.000|20101230143437.000|TR0|who works at Delta, that says, please 
20101230143437.000|20101230143440.000|TR0|allow me to check your luggage status.  
20101230143440.000|20101230143442.000|TR0|And it says follower DM, Delta Assist,

20101230143445.000|20101230143447.000|TR0|inconvenience.  This, folks, is someone 
20101230143447.000|20101230143450.000|TR0|inside Delta communicating on Twitter with 
20101230143450.000|20101230143452.000|TR0|someone who is concerned about their 
20101230143452.000|20101230143455.000|TR0|luggage.

20101230143500.000|20101230143502.000|TR0|has been interacting with all these 
20101230143502.000|20101230143505.000|TR0|passengers, as well.  I pulled up an 
20101230143505.000|20101230143507.000|TR0|example here.  This is someone writing 
20101230143507.000|20101230143510.000|TR0|from JetBlue, writing to a passenger this 
20101230143510.000|20101230143512.000|TR0|morning saying, please follow us so we may 
20101230143512.000|20101230143515.000|TR0|DM to assist you.  Thank you.
20101230143515.000|20101230143517.000|TR0|
20101230143517.000|20101230143520.000|TR0|Now, if you're new to Twitter you probably 
20101230143520.000|20101230143522.000|TR0|don't know what DM is.  So, what I want to 
20101230143522.000|20101230143525.000|TR0|do is, I want to talk you through how to 
20101230143525.000|20101230143527.000|TR0|use Twitter to help you if you're trying 
20101230143527.000|20101230143530.000|TR0|to change your reservation and you just 
20101230143530.000|20101230143532.000|TR0|can't get it done on the phone.
20101230143532.000|20101230143535.000|TR0|
20101230143535.000|20101230143537.000|TR0|Here are the basic steps.  First of all, 
20101230143537.000|20101230143540.000|TR0|what you need it do if you're not already 
20101230143540.000|20101230143542.000|TR0|on Twitter, you sign up.  If you already 
20101230143542.000|20101230143545.000|TR0|are, you sign in. Then, this is the key.  
20101230143545.000|20101230143547.000|TR0|The first thing to do is to go to the 
20101230143547.000|20101230143550.000|TR0|Twitter feed for your airline and click 
20101230143550.000|20101230143552.000|TR0|follow, to follow them.  That will allow 
20101230143552.000|20101230143555.000|TR0|you to communicate with them and it will 
20101230143555.000|20101230143557.000|TR0|show you everything that they've said so 
20101230143557.000|20101230143600.000|TR0|far about all sorts of flights.  Then, a 
20101230143600.000|20101230143602.000|TR0|couple steps more to know.  You can send a 
20101230143602.000|20101230143605.000|TR0|Tweet to them but don't include personal 
20101230143605.000|20101230143607.000|TR0|information about you because that's 
20101230143607.000|20101230143610.000|TR0|public. And after that, once you've signed 
20101230143610.000|20101230143612.000|TR0|in, there's something called a direct 
20101230143612.000|20101230143615.000|TR0|message, a AM.  Send a direct message to 
20101230143615.000|20101230143617.000|TR0|the airline.  You say, here's the problem, 
20101230143617.000|20101230143620.000|TR0|here's what I need.
20101230143620.000|20101230143622.000|TR0|

20101230143927.000|20101230143930.000|TR0|making it harder to live entirely on 
20101230143930.000|20101230143932.000|TR0|nutrition-free junk free.  The fact is, an 
20101230143932.000|20101230143935.000|TR0|apple is fewer than 15 grams of sugar.  
20101230143935.000|20101230143937.000|TR0|You got to consider that a large soda is 
20101230143937.000|20101230143940.000|TR0|over 80 grams of sugar and it's also that

20101230143942.000|20101230143945.000|TR0|studies show that people -- dieters who 
20101230143945.000|20101230143947.000|TR0|have the highest levels of key nutrients 
20101230143947.000|20101230143949.000|TR0|lose weight and a half times more weight 
20101230143949.000|20101230143952.000|TR0|as those who don't get the key nutrients.
20101230143952.000|20101230143954.000|TR0|

20101230144114.000|20101230144117.000|TR0|work.  Ninety-five percent of diets fail.  
20101230144117.000|20101230144119.000|TR0|And the problem is, you go on a diet, you 
20101230144119.000|20101230144122.000|TR0|lose a lot of weight, but a lot of that is 
20101230144122.000|20101230144124.000|TR0|muscle.  When you gain the weight back or 
20101230144124.000|20101230144127.000|TR0|more, it's almost entirely fat.  So now 
20101230144127.000|20101230144129.000|TR0|your metabolism slows down, you feel 
20101230144129.000|20101230144132.000|TR0|sluggish.  That's no fun, which is why 
20101230144132.000|20101230144134.000|TR0|with "Eat This, Not That," we've been 
20101230144134.000|20101230144137.000|TR0|really pushing people to be calorie 
20101230144137.000|20101230144139.000|TR0|conscious, have all of their favorite

20101230144242.000|20101230144244.000|TR0|percent to ten percent of our diet.  If
